abstract.text: A query that returns changes to the HealthKit store, including a snapshot of new changes and continuous monitoring as a long-running query.

inlineContent.text: Anchored object queries provide an easy way to search for new data in the HealthKit store. An

returns an anchor value that corresponds to the last sample or deleted object received by that query. Subsequent queries can use this anchor to restrict their results to only newer saved or deleted objects.
Anchored object queries are mostly immutable. You can assign the query’s
property after instantiating the object, but you must set all other properties when you instantiate the object. You can’t change them.
The anchored object query can combine the abilities of a regular query with a long-running query.
It grabs a snapshot of the data currently stored in the HealthKit store (like an
It can also perform a long-running query that responds to updates (like an

Often, it’s more efficient to set up and run a single anchored object query than to run separate sample and observer queries. As a result, you may want to use anchored object queries, even when you aren’t using anchors to limit the results. In this case, set the anchor parameter to

abstract.text: Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.
A query for reading activity summary objects from the HealthKit store.
A query interface that reads activity summaries using Swift concurrency.
A query that returns changes to the HealthKit store, including a snapshot of new changes and continuous monitoring as a long-running query.
Creates an anchored object query that matches any of the query descriptors you provided.
Initializes a new anchored object query.
Initializes a new anchored object query.
Handler for monitoring updates to the HealthKit store.
A query interface that runs anchored object queries using Swift concurrency.
An object that represents a sample that has been deleted from the HealthKit store.
A value indicating that the query returns all the matching samples in the HealthKit store.
A long-running query that monitors the HealthKit store and updates your app when the HealthKit store saves or deletes a matching sample.
An abstract class for all the query classes in HealthKit.
An object used to identify all the samples previously returned by an anchored object query.
A general query that returns a snapshot of all the matching samples currently saved in the HealthKit store.
Learn about the architecture and design of the HealthKit framework.
Create and run an anchored object query.
Create and run observer queries.
Receive segments and distance samples during downhill skiing and snowboarding workout sessions.

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
